body:
Sorry, but I am still getting this error on 0.1.12_2 (installed from binary) on a CPU-only machine. Specifically, the error msg
```
Loading model file... Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./translate.py", line 193, in <module>
    translator = onmt.Translator(opt)
  File "/home/user/chunk/onmt/Translator.py", line 12, in __init__
    checkpoint = torch.load(opt.model, map_location=lambda storage, loc: storage)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 229, in load
    return _load(f, map_location, pickle_module)
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 377, in _load
    result = unpickler.load()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torch/cuda/__init__.py", line 272, in __new__
    _lazy_init()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torch/cuda/__init__.py", line 84, in _lazy_init
    _check_driver()
  File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/torch/cuda/__init__.py", line 58, in _check_driver
    http://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx""")
AssertionError: (AssertionError('\nFound no NVIDIA driver on your system. Please check that you\nhave an NVIDIA GPU and installed a driver from\nhttp://www.nvidia.com/Download/index.aspx',), <class 'torch.cuda.FloatTensor'>, ())
```

seemed like `unpickler.load()` somehow triggered cuda init?
